title: Han Fei
summary: Han Fei (/hɑːn/;[2] traditional Chinese: 韓非; simplified Chinese: 韩非; pinyin: Hán Fēi; c. 280 – 233 BC), also known as Han Fei Zi, was a Chinese philosopher or statesman[3] of the "Legalist" (Fajia) school during the Warring States period, and a prince of the state of Han.[4]
